meanings.definition: To summarize or condense something into a concise form.
meanings.sent1: She capsulizes the story for her friends to understand easily.
meanings.sent2: The teacher capsulizes the lesson at the end of each class.
meanings.sent3: His ability to capsulize complex ideas is truly impressive.
meanings.sent4: The infographic capsulizes the entire report in a single image.
meanings.sent5: The book capsulizes the history of the country in just a few pages.

meanings.definition: To encapsulate or enclose something in a capsule or similar container.
meanings.sent1: The scientist capsulizes the medicine for convenient consumption.
meanings.sent2: The company capsulizes the essential oils for easy application.
meanings.sent3: The artist capsulizes tiny objects in resin for unique jewelry.
meanings.sent4: The spacecraft capsulizes the astronauts for their journey into space.
meanings.sent5: The capsule capsulizes the delicate cargo to protect it during transport.
